text: The 1914 Virginia Cavaliers football team represented the Virginia Cavaliers of the University of Virginia during the 1914 college football season. The Cavaliers were coached by Joseph M. Wood in his 1st year as head coach, compiling a record of 8-1 and outscoring opponents 353 to 38. ==Schedule== ==Players== ===Varsity lettermen=== ====Line==== {|class="wikitable" |- |- |Rube Barker|| tackle|| ||East St. Louis, Illinois|| || ||175 |- |Harris Coleman|| guard|| ||Stanford, Kentucky |- |Peyton Evans|| center |- |James T. Gillette|| end |- |Claude Moore|| guard |- |James Clay Ward|| tackle |- |James L. White|| end|| ||Macon, Georgia |} ====Backfield==== {|class="wikitable" |- |- |- |Robert Kent Gooch|| quarterback|| ||Roanoke, Virginia |- |Buck Mayer|| halfback|| ||Norfolk, Virginia|| || ||172 |- |M. A. Sparr|| fullback |- |William E. Word|| halfback |} ====Subs==== {|class="wikitable" |- |- |George Wayne Anderson|| center |- |W. Watkins Flannagan|| end |- |Edward C. Anderson|| halfback |- |Norberne Berkeley|| quarterback |- |Knox Walker|| fullback |} ==References== Virginia Category:Virginia Cavaliers football seasons Category:1914 in sports in Virginia Category:South Atlantic Intercollegiate Athletic Association football champion seasons
